p: Studies have shown that the volcanic eruption 800 years ago in Changbai Mountain destroyed the vegetation completely and caused a primary succession of vegetation. After the volcanic disturbance, the process of succession could be divided into five stages: bare land, lichen-bryophyte community, herbaceous community, shrub-herbaceous community, and shrub community [ 63]. Our previous studies have also confirmed that vegetation succession stages differed on different slopes due to the varying degrees of volcanic disturbance. R. chrysanthum and V. uliginosum dominated in the climax stage of succession on the north-facing slope, and a large number of bare land and herbaceous plants distributed in the initial stage of succession on the east-facing slope [ 35].
